abstract.description:
Abstract for the citation. This is used most when the
 citation is extracted from a bibliographic database that
 contains full text or abstract information.

rcsb_description.text:
Abstract for the citation. This is used most when the
 citation is extracted from a bibliographic database that
 contains full text or abstract information.

abstract_id_CAS.description:
The Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) abstract identifier;
 relevant for journal articles.

rcsb_description.text:
The Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) abstract identifier;
 relevant for journal articles.

book_id_ISBN.description:
The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) code assigned to
 the book cited; relevant for books or book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) code assigned to
 the book cited; relevant for books or book chapters.

book_publisher.description:
The name of the publisher of the citation; relevant
 for books or book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The name of the publisher of the citation; relevant
 for books or book chapters.

book_publisher_city.description:
The location of the publisher of the citation; relevant
 for books or book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The location of the publisher of the citation; relevant
 for books or book chapters.

book_title.description:
The title of the book in which the citation appeared; relevant
 for books or book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The title of the book in which the citation appeared; relevant
 for books or book chapters.

coordinate_linkage.description:
_citation.coordinate_linkage states whether this citation
 is concerned with precisely the set of coordinates given in the
 data block. If, for instance, the publication described the same
 structure, but the coordinates had undergone further refinement
 prior to the creation of the data block, the value of this data
 item would be 'no'.

rcsb_description.text:
_citation.coordinate_linkage states whether this citation
 is concerned with precisely the set of coordinates given in the
 data block. If, for instance, the publication described the same
 structure, but the coordinates had undergone further refinement
 prior to the creation of the data block, the value of this data
 item would be 'no'.

country.description:
The country/region of publication; relevant for books
 and book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The country/region of publication; relevant for books
 and book chapters.

database_id_CSD.description:
Identifier ('refcode') of the database record in the Cambridge
 Structural Database that contains details of the cited structure.

rcsb_description.text:
Identifier ('refcode') of the database record in the Cambridge
 Structural Database that contains details of the cited structure.

database_id_Medline.description:
Accession number used by Medline to categorize a specific
 bibliographic entry.

rcsb_description.text:
Accession number used by Medline to categorize a specific
 bibliographic entry.

examples:
citation relates to this precise
                                  coordinate set

citation relates to earlier low-resolution
                                  structure

citation relates to further refinement of
                                  structure reported in citation 2
details.description:
A description of special aspects of the relationship
 of the contents of the data block to the literature item cited.

rcsb_description.text:
A description of special aspects of the relationship
 of the contents of the data block to the literature item cited.

id.description:
The value of _citation.id must uniquely identify a record in the
 CITATION list.

 The _citation.id 'primary' should be used to indicate the
 citation that the author(s) consider to be the most pertinent to
 the contents of the data block.

 Note that this item need not be a number; it can be any unique
 identifier.

rcsb_description.text:
The value of _citation.id must uniquely identify a record in the
 CITATION list.

 The _citation.id 'primary' should be used to indicate the
 citation that the author(s) consider to be the most pertinent to
 the contents of the data block.

 Note that this item need not be a number; it can be any unique
 identifier.

journal_abbrev.description:
Abbreviated name of the cited journal as given in the
 Chemical Abstracts Service Source Index.

rcsb_description.text:
Abbreviated name of the cited journal as given in the
 Chemical Abstracts Service Source Index.

The PDB (i.e., the Chemical Abstracts) abbreviation for a journal. If you do not know the abbreviation, then give the complete  name of the journal and we will try and find it for you. If it is a book or other monographic work, state the full title.
Citation Journal Name

journal_full.description: Full name of the cited journal; relevant for journal articles.

rcsb_description.text: Full name of the cited journal; relevant for journal articles.

journal_id_ASTM.description:
The American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) code
 assigned to the journal cited (also referred to as the CODEN
 designator of the Chemical Abstracts Service); relevant for
 journal articles.

rcsb_description.text:
The American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) code
 assigned to the journal cited (also referred to as the CODEN
 designator of the Chemical Abstracts Service); relevant for
 journal articles.

journal_id_CSD.description:
The Cambridge Structural Database (CSD) code assigned to the
 journal cited; relevant for journal articles. This is also the
 system used at the Protein Data Bank (PDB).

rcsb_description.text:
The Cambridge Structural Database (CSD) code assigned to the
 journal cited; relevant for journal articles. This is also the
 system used at the Protein Data Bank (PDB).

journal_id_ISSN.description:
The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) code assigned to
 the journal cited; relevant for journal articles.

rcsb_description.text:
The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) code assigned to
 the journal cited; relevant for journal articles.

journal_issue.description:
Issue number of the journal cited; relevant for journal
 articles.

rcsb_description.text:
Issue number of the journal cited; relevant for journal
 articles.

journal_volume.description:
Volume number of the journal cited; relevant for journal
 articles.

rcsb_description.text:
Volume number of the journal cited; relevant for journal
 articles.
The volume number of the journal in which the article appeared. Example: 317

language.description: Language in which the cited article is written.

rcsb_description.text: Language in which the cited article is written.

page_first.description:
The first page of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The first page of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.
The starting page number of this article.

page_last.description:
The last page of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The last page of the citation; relevant for journal

Document Object Identifier used by doi.org to uniquely
 specify bibliographic entry.

Ascession number used by PubMed to categorize a specific
 bibliographic entry.

rcsb_description.text:
Ascession number used by PubMed to categorize a specific
 bibliographic entry.

items.description:
Names of the authors of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.  Names are separated by vertical bars.

 The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any
 dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

rcsb_description.text:
Names of the authors of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.  Names are separated by vertical bars.

 The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any
 dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).
Citation Author

rcsb_is_primary.description: Flag to indicate a primary citation.

rcsb_description.text: Flag to indicate a primary citation.
Normalized journal abbreviation.
Citation Journal Name (Abbreviated)

examples:
Structure of diferric duck ovotransferrin
                                  at 2.35 Angstroms resolution.
title.description:
The title of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books
 and book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The title of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books
 and book chapters.

Title of the article or chapter or part of a book. This should be marked NULL if the author(s) listed wrote the entire book (or other work) and no sub-section of the book is being cited. Example: The Structure of Crystalline Profilin-Beta-Actin
Citation Title

unpublished_flag.description: Flag to indicate that this citation will not be published.

rcsb_description.text: Flag to indicate that this citation will not be published.

year.description:
The year of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books
 and book chapters.

rcsb_description.text:
The year of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books
 and book chapters.
The year of publication of the article. Example: 2002
Citation Publication Year

citation_id.description:
This data item is a pointer to _citation.id in the CITATION
 category.

rcsb_description.text:
This data item is a pointer to _citation.id in the CITATION
 category.

identifier_ORCID.description: The Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

rcsb_description.text: The Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

name.description:
Name of an author of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.

 The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any
 dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

rcsb_description.text:
Name of an author of the citation; relevant for journal
 articles, books and book chapters.

 The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any
 dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

Author of a journal article, book chapter, whole book, or thesis. It is not to be used for editor(s) names. Provide the authors' name by using surname (family, or last name), a comma, followed by period separated initials for first and middle names. The word Junior is abbreviated as Jr. Umlauts and other character modifiers should not be included.
Citation Author

ordinal.description:
This data item defines the order of the author's name in the
 list of authors of a citation.

classification.description:

 major function.

compiler_name.description: The compiler used to compile the software.

rcsb_description.text: The compiler used to compile the software.

compiler_version.description: The version of the compiler used to compile the software.

rcsb_description.text: The version of the compiler used to compile the software.

contact_author.description:
The recognized contact author of the software. This could be
 the original author, someone who has modified the code or
 someone who maintains the code.  It should be the person
 most commonly associated with the code.

The recognized contact author of the software. This could be

 someone who maintains the code.  It should be the person

title: schema: sequence_clusters collection: cluster_provenance version: 1.2.3
description: RCSB Exchange Database JSON schema derived from the sequence_clusters content type schema. This schema supports collection cluster_provenance version 1.2.3. This schema is hosted in repository https://github.com/rcsb/py-rcsb.db/tree/master/rcsb.db/data/json-schema/json-schema-min-cluster_provenance.json and follows JSON schema specification version 4
